general.name: General Knowledge & Definitions

questions.question: The broker right to commission or to claim reimbursement of expenses incurred shall be lost if they worked for the benefit of the other party in contravention to their obligations towards whom they represent, or if they accept a promise to obtain a benefit from the other party in circumstances where the rules of good faith and the Professional Ethics Charter prevent the acceptance of such a promise.
Which of the following is a required duty by a Broker towards his/her client?
According to the Code of Ethics, breaching the client privacy includes revealing the reason for the sale, or other private knowledge without your client permission.
Disciplinary action is a punishment resulting from RERA investigating and confirming a complaint against a licensee.
Registered brokers have an ethical duty not to withhold relevant information, deliberately or unintentionally, from a Buyer or a Seller out of fear of losing the listing/deal.

note: Full question bank contains 566 questions. This JSON shows structure - full data to be imported from CSV during build process.
